page.title: 06 POLLUTION
page.content: {Pollution}is chemicals, rubbish, waste etc. Rubbish and waste is usually found in rivers, streams and marshes. {Chemicals}are found in the air and the main contributor in this area is the coalite which pumps loads of coal dust and chemicals into the air every day. Another very big cause of air pollution is the{exhaust fumes}from cars, buses, lorries and other land vehicles. About sixty years ago {pollution}was very rare unlike today when it is very common. We went on a walk on the 26th June 1985 and found out that{87%}of all the streams and rivers we saw were polluted and only 13% were not polluted. We found plastic bottles, rubber tyres, tin cans, a bucket and glass bottles in just one stream.
